data.title: Custom types appear on wrong dialogs
data.body:
Custom Nodes and Resources show up in the different create dialogs. So Nodes appear under Create Resource Dialog and vice-versa.

Furthermore, they don't appear by default when you open the editor, only after a search.

data.title: Steam version can't open scripts in external editors
data.body:
_Bugsquad edit:_ Repurposed the issue to handle the bug described in https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/5614#issuecomment-231552662, i.e. that the Steam version of Godot can't open external editors properly.

---

I hope that clicking the Script icon would open it in Third-party editor, like gedit.

So I can enter chinese comment to script.

data.title: Drag and drop reparenting bug with multiple nodes with children
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Mageia 6 x64, current Godot HEAD.

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Reparenting multiple groups of nodes (i.e. nodes with children) with drag and drop can lead to weird results e.g.:
- My selection
  ![spectacle w25473](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/16708736/6f8c9fc0-45fd-11e6-8cf3-517efddc0e4e.png)
- I drag and drop between "copyright" and "welcome":
  ![spectacle s25499](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/16708741/968c5bc4-45fd-11e6-9c17-30976bb3a0a2.png)
- Result: all the children of "sky_foreground" got messed up and added as siblings.
- It doesn't even preserve order as "alpaca_container" gets nudged between two were-children-now-siblings of "sky_foreground".

**Steps to reproduce:**
See above.

data.title: Fix EditorSpatialGizmo virtual functions not being called
data.body: Fix EditorSpatialGizmo virtual functions not being called on scripts, and bind `EditorSpatialGizmo::clear`, method used to remove all handles, lines, meshes and collisions triangles and segments.

data.title: keyword "pass" does not accept ";" after it
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
2.0.3stable

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

The keyword `pass` does not accepts `;` just after it.

TBH, i don't really care about this "bug". 

I open this issue just in case it is the symptom of an underlying more obscure bug into the gdscript parser or the script editor.

**Steps to reproduce:**

```
func whatever(): #{
    pass;
#}
```

-----> `error( XXX, xx ): Error parsing expression, misplaced : ";"`

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: Fix help search dialog titles
Add _released() virtual method to BaseButton, the contrary to the already existing _pressed()
data.body:
I find the current system with the `set_click_on_press(bool enable)`-method rather awkward to use. Often, it would be usefull if a `_pressed()` method in combination with a `_released()` method would exist. Here's my proposal:
- `_pressed()` Called when button _begins_ being pressed
- `_released()` Contrary to `_pressed()`: Called when button _stops_ being pressed
- `_clicked()` Works like the current `_pressed()` method works

data.title: Asset library segfaults in Map::has(key) upon installing a downloaded package
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Mageia 6 x86, GCC 5.4.0, current HEAD. Happens with both `openssl=builtin` and `openssl=yes`.

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Trying to installing a download package triggers a segmentation fault in `Map::has(key)`:

```
Thread 1 "godot-git" received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
0x0000000000dcc0d8 in Map<String, ProgressDialog::Task, Comparator<String>, DefaultAllocator>::has (this=0x368, p_key=...) at core/map.h:610
610                     if (!_data._root)
(gdb) bt

#1  0x0000000000dcaeb4 in ProgressDialog::add_task (this=0x0, p_task=..., p_label=..., p_steps=198) at tools/editor/progress_dialog.cpp:178
#2  0x0000000000ddcf2a in EditorAssetInstaller::ok_pressed (this=0x4a82bf0) at tools/editor/editor_asset_installer.cpp:248

#5  0x000000000183ca3f in Object::call (this=0x4a82bf0, p_method=..., p_args=0x7fffffffb590, p_argcount=0, r_error=...) at core/object.cpp:896
#6  0x000000000183e503 in Object::emit_signal (this=0x4a85700, p_name=..., p_args=0x7fffffffb590, p_argcount=0) at core/object.cpp:1209
#7  0x000000000183e981 in Object::emit_signal (this=0x4a85700, p_name=..., p_arg1=..., p_arg2=..., p_arg3=..., p_arg4=..., p_arg5=...) at core/object.cpp:1253
#8  0x0000000000f6d39b in BaseButton::_input_event (this=0x4a85700, p_event=...) at scene/gui/base_button.cpp:117
#9  0x00000000009d44e6 in MethodBind1<InputEvent>::call (this=0x35ec430, p_object=0x4a85700, p_args=0x7fffffffc140, p_arg_count=1, r_error=...) at core/method_bind.inc:653
#10 0x000000000183bdc1 in Object::call_multilevel (this=0x4a85700, p_method=..., p_args=0x7fffffffc140, p_argcount=1) at core/object.cpp:622
#11 0x000000000183c61f in Object::call_multilevel (this=0x4a85700, p_name=..., p_arg1=..., p_arg2=..., p_arg3=..., p_arg4=..., p_arg5=...) at core/object.cpp:830
#12 0x0000000000f0ae68 in Viewport::_gui_call_input (this=0x387a540, p_control=0x4a85700, p_input=...) at scene/main/viewport.cpp:1592
#13 0x0000000000f0c304 in Viewport::_gui_input_event (this=0x387a540, p_event=...) at scene/main/viewport.cpp:1892
#14 0x0000000000f0ead5 in Viewport::input (this=0x387a540, p_event=...) at scene/main/viewport.cpp:2406
#15 0x0000000000f0a1e1 in Viewport::_vp_input (this=0x387a540, p_ev=...) at scene/main/viewport.cpp:1435
#16 0x00000000009788a8 in MethodBind1<InputEvent const&>::call (this=0x35b3c70, p_object=0x387a540, p_args=0x7fffffffce60, p_arg_count=1, r_error=...) at core/method_bind.inc:653
#17 0x000000000183ca3f in Object::call (this=0x387a540, p_method=..., p_args=0x7fffffffce60, p_argcount=1, r_error=...) at core/object.cpp:896
#18 0x000000000183c576 in Object::call (this=0x387a540, p_name=..., p_arg1=..., p_arg2=..., p_arg3=..., p_arg4=..., p_arg5=...) at core/object.cpp:770
#19 0x0000000000eef60a in SceneTree::call_group (this=0x38b4370, p_call_flags=2, p_group=..., p_function=..., p_arg1=..., p_arg2=..., p_arg3=..., p_arg4=..., p_arg5=...)
    at scene/main/scene_main_loop.cpp:215
#20 0x0000000000ef0243 in SceneTree::input_event (this=0x38b4370, p_event=...) at scene/main/scene_main_loop.cpp:431
#21 0x000000000041b201 in InputDefault::parse_input_event (this=0x344dca0, p_event=...) at main/input_default.cpp:338
#22 0x0000000000412665 in OS_X11::process_xevents (this=0x7fffffffd780) at platform/x11/os_x11.cpp:1450

```

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Start the project manager, go to "Templates"
2. Toggle the "Testing" repo in the "Support.." menu
3. Click the Minilens icon, click Install
4. Once downloaded, click Install, click again Install in the Packager Installer
=> Segfault

An example with the RichTextLabel demo:
- `bbcode/enabled = true`:
  ![spectacle h13254](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/16707941/8d699f46-45e1-11e6-91fe-970d9663f94b.png)
- `bbcode/enabled = false`:
  ![spectacle w13254](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/16707933/611f9e2c-45e1-11e6-8753-81eff71f5a58.png)

Fixes #5605.

data.title: RichTextLabel does not display if bbcode/enabled == false
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Mageia 6 x64, Godot 2.0.3 and git HEAD (0e119a9).

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
The contents of a RichTextLabel won't display at all if `bbcode/enabled` is false/unticked (which is btw the default value). It also behaves inconsistently in the editor and in running games:
- In the editor, ticking `bbcode/enabled` will make the text appear, but unticking it won't make it disappear.
- In the running game, it shows if ticked, and doesn't show if unticked.

The likely wanted behaviour is that `bbcode/enabled` toggles the parsing of BBCode tags, but not the display of the full text. I.e. a RichTextLabel with "Hello [b]world[/b]" should be displayed as "Hello [b]world[/b]" if `bbcode/enabled` is false, and as "Hello **world**" if `bbcode/enabled` is true.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Add a RichTextLabel to a scene
2. Set some text using the inspector, see that it doesn't display
3. Tick `bbcode/enabled`, see that it appears
4. Untick `bbcode/enabled`, see that it's still visible
5. Run the scene, see that it's not visible

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
Above steps should be enough. Check the RichTextLabel demo for a ready-to-try scene.

data.title: Running a static code analyser on Godot's codebase
data.body:
Have any of you tried to run a static code analyser on Godot's codebase? GCC offers extra analysis via the `-Wextra` and `-Weffc++` flags, Clang comes with its own static analyzer `clang-check` and there are a few standalone programs that perform static analysis (like `cppcheck`).

I tried to use `clang-check` but it requires a compilation database, which can be generated automatically from CMake but not from scons.

It should be a good way to find memory leaks and poor loops automatically, if anything.

Ubuntu 16.04

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

If you restart the project with an error in the script, then the reset value of the variable in the Inspector.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. `export var test = 'a'`
2. The inspector 'a' change to 'b'
3. Add a string to simulate errors.
4. `export var test = 'a'
x`
5. Save the project and restart the project.

data.title: OSX export: Default to fat format, make it an enum
data.body:
Since we want to distribute only the fat binary in the official templates, this should
make it work out of the box. 32 bits and 64 bits options are still available for people
that want them, but will throw an error if the binaries are not in the template zip.

data.title: Editor Crashes While Saving
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** Windows 7 x64, Godot 2.0.3 Stable.

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected): When trying to add sprites to one of my scenes, the editor crashes while saving. This has happened four times in a row now.

**Steps to reproduce:** Open the attached project. Open the scene `res://Basketball/Grandpa.tscn`. Add a Sprite to the Grandpa object. Load the texture `res://Basketball/GFX/Torso.png` for the sprite. Rename the newly created node to Torso. Press CTRL + S.

Actually, it seems like the crash will occur if you just try to save `res://Basketball/Grandpa.tscn` in any capacity.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome): 
[Crash.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/354868/Crash.zip)

data.title: Fix own world option of Viewport.
data.body:
It happens when the viewport has WorldEnviroment child with a valid Environment. More info about this fix in this [comment](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/5482#issuecomment-231211008).

Closes #5482.

data.title: Godot as flatpak runtime
data.body: It would be cool if there was an xdg-app/flatpak runtime package that would provide godot to any games that want to use it. The godot editor can then be a flatpak app based on that runtime.

data.title: Wrong mouse pos with HTML5 exports
data.body:
**Dev environment:**
Windows 10 64bit
Godot 2.0.3

**Issue description:**
get_global_mouse_pos (or get_viewport().get_mouse_pos()) always returns 0 on HTML5 export.
Works as expected on Godot.

**Code example:**

```
extends Node2D
func _ready():
    set_fixed_process(true)
func _fixed_process(delta):
    if (Input.is_mouse_button_pressed(BUTTON_LEFT)):
        print(get_global_mouse_pos(), " / ", get_viewport().get_mouse_pos())
```

**File example:**
https://www.dropbox.com/s/pyfezoozjiyenom/issue_html5_mouse_pos.zip?dl=0

data.title: set_text can not accept str(number)  REF.#268
data.body:
Hello,

**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 7 32b or Windows 10 64b
Godot_v2.0.3_stable_win32

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Function get_node("label").set_text(str(10)) doenst work.
When Exporting to Windows Desktop or Android (Works on F5)

**DEBUG Error**
Cannot convert Argument 1 from Bool to String

**Steps to reproduce:**
this can not work:
get_node("label").set_text(str(10))

this can not work:
texto = str(10)
get_node("label").set_text(texto)

this can work:
get_node("label").set_text("10")

this can work:
texto = "10"
get_node("label").set_text(texto)

Regards,

data.title: fix zippack bugs
data.body:
1.fix godot_open reopen an opened zip pack file.
2.use archive parameter instead of ZipArchive::get_singleton()
3.load zipped file into memory file if seek called(better performance for zip access file seek)

data.title: Removing some more unused vars and dead code
Doctool: change content indentation
data.body:
This changes doctools indentation to the most commonly used indentation (the latter option [here](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/4483#issuecomment-215697559)).

fixes #4483, although some long paragraphs that are indented manually should be corrected manually.

data.title: skip_test statement has no effect in DEFAULT_OP_ARRAY_CMD
data.body:
Seen in the build log:

```
core/variant_op.cpp:983:12: warning: statement has no effect [-Wunused-value]
   skip_test;\
            ^
core/variant_op.cpp:1002:2: note: in expansion of macro 'DEFAULT_OP_ARRAY_CMD'
  DEFAULT_OP_ARRAY_CMD(m_name, const DVector<dv_type>, 0, return arr->get(index))
  ^
core/variant_op.cpp:2425:3: note: in expansion of macro 'DEFAULT_OP_DVECTOR_GET'
   DEFAULT_OP_DVECTOR_GET(VECTOR2_ARRAY, Vector2)
   ^
```

Relevant code is here: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/d08092e/core/variant_op.cpp#L981-L983
